ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###CustomerTicketTemplates
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration for the customer interface.

NavBar.Name: Ticket Templates
NavBar.Description: Create new ticket from predefined template.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CustomModule###002-TicketTemplateHandler
ConfigItem.Description: Overloads (redefines) existing functions in Kernel::System::Ticket. Used to easily add customizations.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Acl::Module###850-LimitTemplateSelections
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket-ACL to restrict selection values if ticket templates are used.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Hook
ConfigItem.Description: The identifier for a ticket, e.g. Ticket#, Call#, MyTicket#. The default is Ticket#.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::HookDivider
ConfigItem.Description: The divider between TicketHook and ticket number. E.g ': '.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SubjectSize
ConfigItem.Description: Max size of the subjects in an email reply and in some overview screens.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SubjectRe
ConfigItem.Description: The text at the beginning of the subject in an email reply, e.g. RE, AW, or AS.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SubjectFwd
ConfigItem.Description: The text at the beginning of the subject when an email is forwarded, e.g. FW, Fwd, or WG.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SubjectFormat
ConfigItem.Description: The format of the subject. 'Left' means '[TicketHook#:12345] Some Subject', 'Right' means 'Some Subject [TicketHook#:12345]', 'None' means 'Some Subject' and no ticket number. In the latter case you should verify that the setting PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0200-References is activated to recognize followups based on email headers.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::MergeDynamicFields
ConfigItem.Description: A list of dynamic fields that are merged into the main ticket during a merge operation. Only dynamic fields that are empty in the main ticket will be set.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CustomQueue
ConfigItem.Description: Name of custom queue. The custom queue is a queue selection of your preferred queues and can be selected in the preferences settings.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CustomService
ConfigItem.Description: Name of custom service. The custom service is a service selection of your preferred services and can be selected in the preferences settings.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::NewArticleIgnoreSystemSender
ConfigItem.Description: Ignore article with system sender type for new article feature (e. g. auto responses or email notifications).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ChangeOwnerToEveryone
ConfigItem.Description: Changes the owner of tickets to everyone (useful for ASP). Normally only agent with rw permissions in the queue of the ticket will be shown.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Responsible
ConfigItem.Description: Enables ticket responsible feature, to keep track of a specific ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ResponsibleAutoSet
ConfigItem.Description: Automatically sets the owner of a ticket as the responsible for it (if ticket responsible feature is enabled). This will only work by manually actions of the logged in user. It does not work for automated actions e.g. GenericAgent, Postmaster and GenericInterface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Type
ConfigItem.Description: Allows defining new types for ticket (if ticket type feature is enabled).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Type::Default
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default ticket type.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Service
ConfigItem.Description: Allows defining services and SLAs for tickets (e. g. email, desktop, network, ...), and escalation attributes for SLAs (if ticket service/SLA feature is enabled).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Service::KeepChildren
ConfigItem.Description: Retains all services in listings even if they are children of invalid elements.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Service::Default::UnknownCustomer
ConfigItem.Description: Allows default services to be selected also for non existing customers.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ArchiveSystem
ConfigItem.Description: Activates the ticket archive system to have a faster system by moving some tickets out of the daily scope. To search for these tickets, the archive flag has to be enabled in the ticket search.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ArchiveSystem::RemoveSeenFlags
ConfigItem.Description: Controls if the ticket and article seen flags are removed when a ticket is archived.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ArchiveSystem::RemoveTicketWatchers
ConfigItem.Description: Removes the ticket watcher information when a ticket is archived.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CustomerArchiveSystem
ConfigItem.Description: Activates the ticket archive system search in the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator
ConfigItem.Description: Selects the ticket number generator module. "AutoIncrement" increments the ticket number, the SystemID and the counter are used with SystemID.counter format (e.g. 1010138, 1010139). With "Date" the ticket numbers will be generated by the current date, the SystemID and the counter. The format looks like Year.Month.Day.SystemID.counter (e.g. 200206231010138, 200206231010139). With "DateChecksum" the counter will be appended as checksum to the string of date and SystemID. The checksum will be rotated on a daily basis. The format looks like Year.Month.Day.SystemID.Counter.CheckSum (e.g. 2002070110101520, 2002070110101535). "Random" generates randomized ticket numbers in the format "SystemID.Random" (e.g. 100057866352, 103745394596).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator::CheckSystemID
ConfigItem.Description: Checks the SystemID in ticket number detection for follow-ups (use "No" if SystemID has been changed after using the system).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator::MinCounterSize
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the minimal ticket counter size if "AutoIncrement" was selected as TicketNumberGenerator. Default is 5, this means the counter starts from 10000.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator::Date::UseFormattedCounter
ConfigItem.Description: Enables the minimal ticket counter size (if "Date" was selected as TicketNumberGenerator).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CounterLog
ConfigItem.Description: Log file for the ticket counter.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::IndexModule
ConfigItem.Description: IndexAccelerator: to choose your backend TicketViewAccelerator module. "RuntimeDB" generates each queue view on the fly from ticket table (no performance problems up to approx. 60.000 tickets in total and 6.000 open tickets in the system). "StaticDB" is the most powerful module, it uses an extra ticket-index table that works like a view (recommended if more than 80.000 and 6.000 open tickets are stored in the system). Use the command "bin/kix.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::QueueIndexRebuild" for initial index creation.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::StorageModule
ConfigItem.Description: Saves the attachments of articles. "DB" stores all data in the database (not recommended for storing big attachments). "FS" stores the data on the filesystem; this is faster but the KIX applications should not be running as root. You can switch between the modules even on a system that is already in production without any loss of data. Note: Searching for attachment names is not supported when "FS" is used.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::StorageModule::CheckAllBackends
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies whether all storage backends should be checked when looking for attachments. This is only required for installations where some attachments are in the file system, and others in the database.

ConfigItem.Name: ArticleDir
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies the directory to store the data in, if "FS" was selected for TicketStorageModule.

ConfigItem.Name: EscalationEvents::DecayTime
ConfigItem.Description: The duration in minutes after emitting an event, in which the new escalation notify and start events are suppressed.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###100-ArchiveRestore
ConfigItem.Description: Restores a ticket from the archive (only if the event is a state change, from closed to any open available state).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###110-AcceleratorUpdate
ConfigItem.Description: Updates the ticket index accelerator.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###120-ForceOwnerResetOnMove
ConfigItem.Description: Resets and unlocks the owner of a ticket if it was moved to another queue.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###130-ForceStateChangeOnLock
ConfigItem.Description: Forces to choose a different ticket state (from current) after lock action. Define the current state as key, and the next state after lock action as content.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###140-ResponsibleAutoSet
ConfigItem.Description: Automatically sets the responsible of a ticket (if it is not set yet) after the first owner update.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###150-TicketPendingTimeReset
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the PendingTime of a ticket to 0 if the state is changed to a non-pending state.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###500-NotificationEvent
ConfigItem.Description: Sends the notifications which are configured in the admin interface under "Notfication (Event)".

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###910-EscalationIndex
ConfigItem.Description: Updates the ticket escalation index after a ticket attribute got updated.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###920-EscalationStopEvents
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket event module that triggers the escalation stop events.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###930-ForceUnlockOnMove
ConfigItem.Description: Forces to unlock tickets after being moved to another queue.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###940-TicketArticleNewMessageUpdate
ConfigItem.Description: Update Ticket "Seen" flag if every article got seen or a new Article got created.

ConfigItem.Name: DynamicFieldFromContact::Mapping
ConfigItem.Description: Define a mapping between variables of the contact data (keys) and dynamic fields of a ticket (values). The purpose is to store contact data in ticket dynamic fields. The dynamic fields must be present in the system and should be enabled for AgentTicketFreeText, so that they can be set/updated manually by the agent. They mustn't be enabled for AgentTicketPhone, AgentTicketEmail and AgentTicketCustomer. If they were, they would have precedence over the automatically set values. To use this mapping, you have to also activate the next setting below.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###950-DynamicFieldFromContact
ConfigItem.Description: This event module stores attributes from Contact as DynamicFields tickets. Please see the setting above for how to configure the mapping.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CustomModule###001-CustomModule
ConfigItem.Description: Overloads (redefines) existing functions in Kernel::System::Ticket. Used to easily add customizations.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchBackend
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the backend module that should be used to search for tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndexModule
ConfigItem.Description: Helps to extend your articles full-text search (From, To, Cc, Subject and Body search). Runtime will do full-text searches on live data (it works fine for up to 50.000 tickets). StaticDB will strip all articles and will build an index after article creation, increasing fulltext searches about 50%. To create an initial index use "bin/kix.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::FulltextIndexRebuild".

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::WarnOnStopWordUsage
ConfigItem.Description: Display a warning and prevent search when using stop words within fulltext search.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::Attribute
ConfigItem.Description: Basic fulltext index settings. Execute "bin/kix.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::FulltextIndexRebuild" in order to generate a new index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::Filters
ConfigItem.Description: Fulltext index regex filters to remove parts of the text.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###en
ConfigItem.Description: English stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###de
ConfigItem.Description: German stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###nl
ConfigItem.Description: Dutch stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###es
ConfigItem.Description: Spanish stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###fr
ConfigItem.Description: French stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###it
ConfigItem.Description: Italian stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###Custom
ConfigItem.Description: Customizable stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###098-ArticleSearchIndex
ConfigItem.Description: Builds an article index right after the article's creation.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::PendingDiffTime
ConfigItem.Description: Time in seconds that gets added to the actual time if setting a pending-state (default: 86400 = 1 day).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::PlainView
ConfigItem.Description: Shows a link to see a zoomed email ticket in plain text.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::HistoryTypes###000-Framework
ConfigItem.Description: Controls how to display the ticket history entries as readable values.

Hash.Item: Ticket moved into Queue "%s" (%s) from Queue "%s" (%s).
%s time unit(s) accounted. Now total %s time unit(s).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::TextAreaNote
ConfigItem.Description: Permitted width for compose note windows.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerDisableCompanyTicketAccess
ConfigItem.Description: This option will deny the access to customer company tickets, which are not created by the contact.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AccountTime
ConfigItem.Description: Activates time accounting.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::TimeUnits
ConfigItem.Description: Sets the prefered time units (e.g. work units, hours, minutes).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::NeedAccountedTime
ConfigItem.Description: Defines if time accounting is mandatory in the agent interface. If activated, a note must be entered for all ticket actions (no matter if the note itself is configured as active or is originally mandatory for the individual ticket action screen).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ShowCustomerTickets
ConfigItem.Description: Shows customer history tickets in AgentTicketPhone, AgentTicketEmail and AgentTicketCustomer.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ResponseFormat
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the format of responses in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface ([% Data.OrigFrom | html %] is From 1:1, [% Data.OrigFromName | html %] is only realname of From).

Setting.TextArea:
[% Data.Salutation | html %] [% Data.StdResponse | html %] [% Data.Signature | html %]
[% Data.Created | Localize("TimeShort") %] - [% Data.OrigFromName | html %] [% Translate("wrote") | html %]: [% Data.Body | html %]

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Quote
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the used character for plaintext email quotes in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface. If this is empty or inactive, original emails will not be quoted but appended to the response.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ResponseQuoteMaxLines
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the maximum number of quoted lines to be added to responses.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AutomaticMergeSubject
ConfigItem.Description: When tickets are merged, a note will be added automatically to the ticket which is no longer active. Here you can define the subject of this note (this subject cannot be changed by the agent).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AutomaticMergeText
ConfigItem.Description: When tickets are merged, a note will be added automatically to the ticket which is no longer active. Here you can define the body of this note (this text cannot be changed by the agent).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ViewableSenderTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default viewable sender types of a ticket (default: customer).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ViewableLocks
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the viewable locks of a ticket. NOTE: When you change this setting, make sure to delete the cache in order to use the new value. Default: unlock, tmp_lock.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ViewableStateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the valid state types for a ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::UnlockStateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the valid states for unlocked tickets. To unlock tickets the script "bin/kix.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::UnlockTimeout" can be used.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::PendingReminderStateType
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the state type of the reminder for pending tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::PendingAutoStateType
ConfigItem.Description: Determines the possible states for pending tickets that changed state after reaching time limit.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::StateAfterPending
ConfigItem.Description: Defines which states should be set automatically (Content), after the pending time of state (Key) has been reached.

ConfigItem.Name: System::Permission
ConfigItem.Description: Standard available permissions for agents within the application. If more permissions are needed, they can be entered here. Permissions must be defined to be effective. Some other good permissions have also been provided built-in: note, close, pending, customer, freetext, move, compose, responsible, forward, and bounce. Make sure that "rw" is always the last registered permission.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission###1-OwnerCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access to the owner of a ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission::OwnerCheck::Queues
ConfigItem.Description: Optional queue limitation for the OwnerCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission###2-ResponsibleCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access to the agent responsible of a ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission::ResponsibleCheck::Queues
ConfigItem.Description: Optional queue limitation for the ResponsibleCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission###4-WatcherCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access to the watcher agents of a ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission###5-CreatorCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access to the creator of a ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission::CreatorCheck::Queues
ConfigItem.Description: Optional queue limitation for the CreatorCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission###6-InvolvedCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access to any agent that has been involved in a ticket in the past (based on ticket history entries).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Permission::InvolvedCheck::Queues
ConfigItem.Description: Optional queue limitation for the InvolvedCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerTicket::Permission###2-ContactIDCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access if the ContactID of the ticket matches the ContactID of the customer.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerTicket::Permission###3-CustomerIDCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to grant access if the CustomerID of the ticket matches the CustomerID of the customer.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::DefineEmailFrom
ConfigItem.Description: Defines how the From field from the emails (sent from answers and email tickets) should look like.

Option.Item: Agent Name + FromSeparator + System Address Display Name

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::DefineEmailFromSeparator
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the separator between the agents real name and the given queue email address.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::DynamicFieldStartTime
ConfigItem.Description: Define dynamic field name for start time. This field has to be manually added to the system as Ticket: "Date / Time" and must be activated in ticket creation screens and/or in any other ticket action screens.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::DynamicFieldEndTime
ConfigItem.Description: Define dynamic field name for end time. This field has to be manually added to the system as Ticket: "Date / Time" and must be activated in ticket creation screens and/or in any other ticket action screens.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::DynamicFieldsForEvents
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the dynamic fields that are used for displaying on calendar events.

ConfigItem.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::TicketFieldsForEvents
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the ticket fields that are going to be displayed calendar events. The "Key" defines the field or ticket attribute and the "Content" defines the display name.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###CustomQueue
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the CustomQueue object in the preference view of the agent interface.

Hash.Item: Your queue selection of your preferred queues. You also get notified about those queues via email if enabled.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###CustomService
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the CustomService object in the preference view of the agent interface.

Hash.Item: Your service selection of your preferred services. You also get notified about those services via email if enabled.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###CreateNextMask
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the CreateNextMask object in the preference view of the agent interface.

Hash.Item: Configure which screen should be shown after a new ticket has been created.

ConfigItem.Name: QueuePreferences###Comment2
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters of the example queue attribute Comment2.

ConfigItem.Name: ServicePreferences###Comment2
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters of the example service attribute Comment2.

ConfigItem.Name: SLAPreferences###Comment2
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters of the example SLA attribute Comment2.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerNotifyJustToRealCustomer
ConfigItem.Description: Sends customer notifications just to the mapped customer.

ConfigItem.Name: AgentSelfNotifyOnAction
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies if an agent should receive email notification of his own actions.

ConfigItem.Name: ContactPreferencesGroups###ShownTickets
ConfigItem.Description: Defines all the parameters for the ShownTickets object in the customer preferences of the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: ContactPreferencesGroups###RefreshTime
ConfigItem.Description: Defines all the parameters for the RefreshTime object in the customer preferences of the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::CommonParam###Action
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default used Frontend-Module if no Action parameter given in the url on the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::CommonParam###TicketID
ConfigItem.Description: Default ticket ID used by the system in the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###900-GenericAgent
ConfigItem.Description: Event module registration. For more performance you can define a trigger event (e. g. Event => TicketCreate).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::GenericAgentTicketSearch###ExtendedSearchCondition
ConfigItem.Description: Allows extended search conditions in ticket search of the generic agent interface. With this feature you can search e. g. ticket title with this kind of conditions like "(*key1*&&*key2*)" or "(*key1*||*key2*)".

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::GenericAgentRunLimit
ConfigItem.Description: Set the limit of tickets that will be executed on a single genericagent job execution.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::UnlockOnAway
ConfigItem.Description: Unlock tickets whenever a note is added and the owner is out of office.

ConfigItem.Name: Events###Ticket
ConfigItem.Description: List of all ticket events to be displayed in the GUI.

ConfigItem.Name: Events###Article
ConfigItem.Description: List of all article events to be displayed in the GUI.

ConfigItem.Name: Events###Queue
ConfigItem.Description: List of all queue events to be displayed in the GUI.

ConfigItem.Name: Queue::EventModulePost###130-UpdateQueue
ConfigItem.Description: Event module that performs an update statement on TicketIndex to rename the queue name there if needed and if StaticDB is actually used.

ConfigItem.Name: Notification::Transport###Email
ConfigItem.Description: Defines all the parameters for this notification transport.

ConfigItem.Name: PreferencesGroups###NotificationEvent
ConfigItem.Description: Transport selection for ticket notifications.

Hash.Item: Choose for which kind of ticket changes you want to receive notifications.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###CustomerTicketOverview
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration for the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###CustomerTicketMessage
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration for the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Acl::Module###1-Ticket::Acl::Module
ConfigItem.Description: ACL module that allows closing parent tickets only if all its children are already closed ("State" shows which states are not available for the parent ticket until all child tickets are closed).

ConfigItem.Name: TicketACL::Default::Action
ConfigItem.Description: Default ACL values for ticket actions.

ConfigItem.Name: ACLKeysLevel1Match
ConfigItem.Description: Defines which items are available in first level of the ACL structure.

ConfigItem.Name: ACLKeysLevel1Change
ConfigItem.Description: Defines which items are available in first level of the ACL structure.

ConfigItem.Name: ACLKeysLevel2::Possible
ConfigItem.Description: Defines which items are available in second level of the ACL structure.

ConfigItem.Name: ACLKeysLevel2::PossibleAdd
ConfigItem.Description: Defines which items are available in second level of the ACL structure.

ConfigItem.Name: ACLKeysLevel2::PossibleNot
ConfigItem.Description: Defines which items are available in second level of the ACL structure.

ConfigItem.Name: ACLKeysLevel2::Properties
ConfigItem.Description: Defines which items are available in second level of the ACL structure.

ConfigItem.Name: ACLKeysLevel2::PropertiesDatabase
ConfigItem.Description: Defines which items are available in second level of the ACL structure.

ConfigItem.Name: ACL::CacheTTL
ConfigItem.Description: Cache time in seconds for the DB ACL backend.

ConfigItem.Name: TicketACL::Debug::Enabled
ConfigItem.Description: If enabled debugging information for ACLs is logged.

ConfigItem.Name: TicketACL::Debug::LogPriority
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the priority in which the information is logged and presented.

ConfigItem.Name: TicketACL::Debug::Filter###00-Default
ConfigItem.Description: Filter for debugging ACLs. Note: More ticket attributes can be added in the format <KIX_TICKET_Attribute> e.g. <KIX_TICKET_Priority>.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterMaxEmails
ConfigItem.Description: Maximal auto email responses to own email-address a day (Loop-Protection).

ConfigItem.Name: PostMasterMaxEmailSize
ConfigItem.Description: Maximal size in KBytes for mails that can be fetched via POP3/POP3S/IMAP/IMAPS (KBytes).

ConfigItem.Name: PostMasterReconnectMessage
ConfigItem.Description: The maximum number of mails fetched at once before reconnecting to the server.

ConfigItem.Name: LoopProtectionModule
ConfigItem.Description: Default loop protection module.

ConfigItem.Name: LoopProtectionLog
ConfigItem.Description: Path for the log file (it only applies if "FS" was selected for LoopProtectionModule and it is mandatory).

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterAutoHTML2Text
ConfigItem.Description: Converts HTML mails into text messages.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterUserID
ConfigItem.Description: Specifies user id of the postmaster data base.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterDefaultQueue
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the postmaster default queue.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterDefaultPriority
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default priority of new tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterDefaultState
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default state of new tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterFollowUpState
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the state of a ticket if it gets a follow-up.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterFollowUpStateClosed
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the state of a ticket if it gets a follow-up and the ticket was already closed.

ConfigItem.Name: PostmasterX-Header
ConfigItem.Description: Defines all the X-headers that should be scanned.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::StrictFollowUp
ConfigItem.Description: Postmaster handles followups and new tickets based on the system address assigned queues.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###1-Match
ConfigItem.Description: Module to filter and manipulate incoming messages. Block/ignore all spam email with From: noreply@ address.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###2-Match
ConfigItem.Description: Module to filter and manipulate incoming messages. Get a 4 digit number to ticket free text, use regex in Match e. g. From => '(.+?)@.+?', and use () as [***] in Set =>.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###3-NewTicketReject
ConfigItem.Description: Blocks all the incoming emails that do not have a valid ticket number in subject with From: @example.com address.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule::NewTicketReject::Sender
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the sender for rejected emails.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule::NewTicketReject::Subject
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the subject for rejected emails.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule::NewTicketReject::Body
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the body text for rejected emails.

Setting.TextArea:
Dear Customer,
Unfortunately we could not detect a valid ticket number in your subject, so this email can't be processed.
Please create a new ticket via the customer panel.
Thanks for your help!
Your Helpdesk Team

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###4-CMD
ConfigItem.Description: CMD example setup. Ignores emails where external CMD returns some output on STDOUT (email will be piped into STDIN of some.bin).

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###5-SpamAssassin
ConfigItem.Description: Spam Assassin example setup. Ignores emails that are marked with SpamAssassin.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###6-SpamAssassin
ConfigItem.Description: Spam Assassin example setup. Moves marked mails to spam queue.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-MatchDBSource
ConfigItem.Description: Module to use database filter storage.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PostFilterModule###000-FollowUpChannelCheck
ConfigItem.Description: Module to check if arrived emails should be marked as email-internal (because of original forwarded internal email). ArticleType and SenderType define the values for the arrived email/article.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition1
ConfigItem.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition2
ConfigItem.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition3
ConfigItem.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition4
ConfigItem.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-DecryptBody
ConfigItem.Description: Module to filter encrypted bodies of incoming messages.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-SMIMEFetchFromCustomer
ConfigItem.Description: Module to fetch contacts SMIME certificates of incoming messages.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0100-Subject
ConfigItem.Description: Checks if an E-Mail is a followup to an existing ticket by searching the subject for a valid ticket number.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0200-References
ConfigItem.Description: Executes follow-up checks on In-Reply-To or References headers for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0300-Body
ConfigItem.Description: Executes follow-up checks on email body for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0400-Attachments
ConfigItem.Description: Executes follow-up checks on attachment contents for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

ConfigItem.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0500-RawEmail
ConfigItem.Description: Executes follow-up checks on the raw source email for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

ConfigItem.Name: SendNoAutoResponseRegExp
ConfigItem.Description: If this regex matches, no message will be send by the autoresponder.

ConfigItem.Name: AutoResponseForWebTickets
ConfigItem.Description: If this option is set to 'Yes', tickets created via the web interface, via Customers or Agents, will receive an autoresponse if configured. If this option is set to 'No', no autoresponses will be sent.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::PossibleLink###0200
ConfigItem.Description: Links 2 tickets using a "Normal" type link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::PossibleLink###0201
ConfigItem.Description: Links 2 tickets using a "ParentChild" type link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::PossibleLink###0202
ConfigItem.Description: Links a ticket with an FAQArticle using a "Normal" type link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::PossibleLink###0203
ConfigItem.Description: Links ticket with an FAQArticle using a "ParentChild" type link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::PossibleLink###0204
ConfigItem.Description: Links a ticket with a ConfigItem using a "DependsOn" type link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::PossibleLink###0205
ConfigItem.Description: Links ticket with a ConfigItem using a "RelevantTo" type link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::PossibleLink###0206
ConfigItem.Description: Links a ticket with a ConfigItem using a "Normal" type link.

ConfigItem.Name: LinkObject::IgnoreLinkedTicketStateTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Defines, which tickets of which ticket state types should not be listed in linked ticket lists.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::DynamicObjectRegistration###Ticket
ConfigItem.Description: Module to generate ticket statistics.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::DynamicObjectRegistration###TicketList
ConfigItem.Description: Determines if the statistics module may generate ticket lists.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::DynamicObjectRegistration###TicketAccountedTime
ConfigItem.Description: Module to generate accounted time ticket statistics.

ConfigItem.Name: Stats::DynamicObjectRegistration###TicketSolutionResponseTime
ConfigItem.Description: Module to generate ticket solution and response time statistics.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::HTMLArticleHeightDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Set the default height (in pixels) of inline HTML articles in AgentTicketZoom.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::HTMLArticleHeightMax
ConfigItem.Description: Set the maximum height (in pixels) of inline HTML articles in AgentTicketZoom.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###TicketDynamicFieldDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Event module registration. For more performance you can define a trigger event (e. g. Event => TicketCreate). This is only possible if all Ticket dynamic fields need the same event.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::TicketDynamicFieldDefault###Element1
ConfigItem.Description: Configures a default TicketDynamicField setting. "Name" defines the dynamic field which should be used, "Value" is the data that will be set, and "Event" defines the trigger event. Please check the developer manual (http://otrs.github.io/doc/), chapter "Ticket Event Module".

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::TicketDynamicFieldDefault###Element2
ConfigItem.Description: Configures a default TicketDynamicField setting. "Name" defines the dynamic field which should be used, "Value" is the data that will be set, and "Event" defines the trigger event. Please check the developer manual (http://otrs.github.io/doc/), chapter "Ticket Event Module".

ConfigItem.Name: StandardTemplate::Types
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the list of types for templates.

ConfigItem.Name: StandardTemplate2QueueByCreating
ConfigItem.Description: List of default Standard Templates which are assigned automatically to new Queues upon creation.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Acl::Module###ProcessProgressAfterClosedChilds
ConfigItem.Description: ACL module that allows progress of parent tickets only if all its children are already closed ("ActivityDialog" shows which ActivityDialogs are not available for the parent ticket until all child tickets are closed).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###900-EscalationIndex
ConfigItem.Description: Updates the ticket escalation index after a ticket attribute got updated.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ResponsetimeSetByPhoneTicket
ConfigItem.Description: Disables response time SLA, if the newly created ticket is a phone ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ResponsetimeSetByPhoneTicket::OnlyForTheseTicketTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Restricts the ResponsetimeSetByPhoneTicket to these ticket types.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ResponsetimeSetByAutoReply
ConfigItem.Description: Disables response time SLA, if an auto reply was sent for this ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ResponsetimeSetByAutoReply::OnlyForTheseTicketTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Restricts the ResponsetimeSetByAutoReply to these ticket types.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EscalationDisabled::RelevantStates
ConfigItem.Description: Defines state names for which the SLA time is disabled. Is a ticket set to on of these states, the SLA-destination times are set to hold. The time a ticket stays in this state is not SLA-relevant.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EscalationDisabled::RelevantTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Defines ticket type names for which the SLA calulation time is disabled.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EscalationDisabled::RelevantQueues
ConfigItem.Description: Defines queue names for which the SLA calulation time is disabled.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EscalationDelayed::FreeTimeField
ConfigItem.Description: Defines a dynamic field of type date/time which is used as start time for solution SLA-computation rather than ticket creation time, thus allowing to start SLA-countdown with begin of customer desired times.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::KIXSidebarBackend###KIXSBCustomer
ConfigItem.Description: Sidebar module registration for the agent interface.

Hash.Item: Suche nach Personen zur Verlinkung am Ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###KIXSidebarCustomerSearchAJAXHandler
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration for the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::KIXSidebarChecklist###ItemStateDefault
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the default item state for new items. It should be one of the item states out of the list below.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::KIXSidebarChecklist###ItemState
ConfigItem.Description: Defines all possible item states for the checklist sidebar. Key has to be unique and used for StateIcon list and StateStyle list below.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::KIXSidebarChecklist###ItemStateIcon
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the item state icons for the item states defined above.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::KIXSidebarChecklist###ItemStateStyle
ConfigItem.Description: Defines the item state styles for the item states defined above. Use CSS-styles.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::KIXSidebarChecklist###NonEditableTicketStates
ConfigItem.Description: Defines all the ticket states in which the checklist cannot be changed.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::KIXSidebarChecklist###NonEditableTicketStateTypes
ConfigItem.Description: Defines all the ticket state types in which the checklist cannot be changed.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Acl::Module###500-RestrictTicketActionsOnMerged
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket-ACL to restrict ticket actions for merged tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::RestrictTicketActionsOnMerged::ActionsMapping
ConfigItem.Description: Defines allowed and not allowed actions for merged and removed tickets.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###AutoCreateLinkedPerson
ConfigItem.Description: Create new linked person on create new Article or Update Owner.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###AddToAddressBook
ConfigItem.Description: Creates a new address book entry if necessary.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CustomModule###010-TicketExtensionsKIX4OTRSITSMIncidentProblem
ConfigItem.Description: Overloads (redefines) existing functions in Kernel::System::Ticket. Used to easily add customizations.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###200-CreateFAQEntry
ConfigItem.Description: Enables creation of a FAQ entry from currently created article.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###230-TicketCreateChecklistFromTicketTemplate
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket event module to create a checklist from ticket template on ticket create.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Acl::Module###995_HideProcessTicketTabs
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket-ACLs to define shown tabs if ticket is process ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###500-TicketAutoLinkConfigItem
ConfigItem.Description: Workflowmodule which links the ticket to related CIs - event handler supports only following events: ArticleCreate, TicketFreeTextUpdate.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::KIXSidebarBackend###KIXSBSimiliarFAQ
ConfigItem.Description: Sidebar module registration for the agent interface.

Hash.Item: Shows FAQ items relevant to current ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###KIXSidebarFAQSearchAJAXHandler
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###KIXSidebarTicketLinkCISearchAJAXHandler
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Acl::Module###950_TicketStateWorkflow
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket-ACLs to define the following possible state.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###700-TicketStateWorkflowTypeUpdate
ConfigItem.Description: Updates ticket state if configured or required after type update.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###701-TicketStateWorkflowAutomaticStateAction
ConfigItem.Description: Moves ticket after state update.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###910-TicketQueueMoveWorkflowTickettype
ConfigItem.Description: Updates ticket type if configured or required after queue move.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::TicketQueueMoveWorkflowTickettype
ConfigItem.Description: Defines Queue, TicketType and new TicketType for TicketQueueMoveWorkflowTickettype.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###920-TicketQueueMoveWorkflowState
ConfigItem.Description: Updates ticket state if configured or required after queue move.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::TicketQueueMoveWorkflowState
ConfigItem.Description: Defines Queue, TicketType and new State for TicketQueueMoveWorkflowState.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###900-TicketStateAutoUpdate
ConfigItem.Description: Updates ticket state after unlock ticket based on selected ticket type.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###900-TicketUnlockOnStateUpdate
ConfigItem.Description: Performs ticket update actions after state update - currently limited to state update.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###701-StateUpdateOnWebrequestFollowUp
ConfigItem.Description: State update for closed tickets if a new article of type webrequest is created in customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###955-RemoveArticleFlagsOnTicketClose
ConfigItem.Description: Performs ticket update actions after state update - currently limited to state update.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###DynamicFieldITSMConfigItemAJAXHandler
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration for the customer interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###ITSMConfigItemLinkAdd
ConfigItem.Description: Create link between ticket and config item on DynamicFieldUpdate (This event only create link, links can only be deleted manually).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Acl::Module###890-HideAgentTicketMove
ConfigItem.Description: Hide AgentTicketMove if service of current ticket has a configured AssignedQueue and ticket is not excluded from automatic queue assigment.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###300-TicketServiceQueueAssignment
ConfigItem.Description: Performs queue update on setting service.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ServiceQueueAssignment###TypeStateExclusions
ConfigItem.Description: Tickets with key Type:::State and value not null will not be moved automatically upon service update.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::KIXSidebarBackend###KIXSBSimilarTickets
ConfigItem.Description: Sidebar module registration for the agent interface.

Hash.Item: Shows similar tickets to current ticket.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::Module###KIXSidebarTicketSearchAJAXHandler
ConfigItem.Description: Frontend module registration for the agent interface.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###9-SystemMonitoringAcknowledgeX
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket event module to send an acknowledge to registered system monitoring tools.

ConfigItem.Name: Notification::Transport###AgentOverlay
ConfigItem.Description: Defines all the parameters for this notification transport.

ConfigItem.Name: CustomerFrontend::KIXSidebarBackend###LinkedCIs
ConfigItem.Description: Parameters for the KIXSidebar backend linked config items.

Hash.Item: Shows all config items assigned to selected customers.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###900-NotificationToOutOfOfficeSubstitute
ConfigItem.Description: Sends all agent's notifications to its configured out of office substitute while agent is out of office.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Acl::Module###802-MatchTicketDataRestrictions
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket-ACL to restrict some ticket data selections based on current ticket data.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Acl::Module###803-MatchActionRestrictions
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket-ACL to restrict some ticket actions based on current ticket data.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###800-ResponsibleAutoSetPerTickettype
ConfigItem.Description: Workflowmodule which sets the ticket responsible based on ticket type if not given.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ResponsibleAutoSetPerTickettype
ConfigItem.Description: If ticket responsible feature is enabled, set responsible on ticket creation or state update.

Option.Item: Set ticket type responsible if not specified
Set owner, if reponsible not specified

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::CustomModule###001-TicketExtensionsKIX4OTRS
ConfigItem.Description: Overloads (redefines) existing functions in Kernel::System::Ticket. Used to easily add customizations.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::ACL-PossiblePropertiesSubsumption
ConfigItem.Description: Defines whether results of PossibleNot for tickets of multiple ACLs are subsumed, thus allowing a more modular approach to ACLS (default behavior is disabled).

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Frontend::DynamicField###DisabledDynamicFields
ConfigItem.Description: Configures which dynamic fields were disabled depending on used frontend module, attributes like service, type, state or priority and its value. The key is composed like FrontendModule:::Attribute::Value. The key should contain the names of the disabled fields using regular expressions. If dynamic fields should be hidden on empty values, use EMPTY like FrontendModule:::Attribute::EMPTY.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::SearchProfileQueue
ConfigItem.Description: Name of search profile queue. The search profile queue is a queue selection of your preferred search profiles.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Acl::Module###990_DependingDynamicFieldSelection
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket-ACLs to define dynamic fields dependencies.

ConfigItem.Name: Ticket::Acl::Module###991_DisabledDynamicFields
ConfigItem.Description: Ticket-ACLs to define shown or hidden dynamic fields in forms.
